intro: Adelobotrys subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems with palmately lobed leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. Its flowers are showy, with five pink to purple petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Adelobotrys subsessilis is often found in moist, open habitats such as swamps and wetlands.
